page.title: 02Dovercourt/Erlams Coastline
page.content:
{Erlams Beach}consists of shallow mudflats with a shingle beach made up of clay ridges, with some inlets of sand and shingle. Small rock pools weave in and out of the clay, and make for exciting finds of crabs, small sea creatures, shells, stones and seaweed.
After this wide belt of clay there is a ridge of small shell particles, followed by pebbles and larger shells. At the top of the beach there is fine sand with tufts of grass : beyond that, salt marshes extend for some distance (the marshes are drained by natural outlets). In the marshes are many interesting birds and sea plants.
At the north end is a sea wall made of earth. Behind it lies an area once used as a landfill, now grassed over as a playing field.
